attributes.action: introduce slow and fast pedestrian lanes on busy pavements.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: In many of Britain's cities, and especially in the capital, the pavements are seemingly overrun by slow walkers. As they are currently allowed to walk in a haphazard fashion across the entire breadth of the pavement, in an entirely uncontrolled manner, this has the effect of slowing down the whole pedestrian traffic. A system of slow and fast lanes would ease this problem, enabling those in a rush, or with a faster than average walking speed, to get to their destination unfettered by the more leisurely pedestrian. If successful, an additional third "cruising" lane could be introduced.

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
